t: Luke 15
The Lost Sheep
Now*p all the tax collectors and the sinners were coming near Him to listen to Him.
Both the Pharisees and the scribes began*i to grumble, saying, “This man receives sinners and eats with them.”
So*p He told them this parable, saying,

“What*r man*r among*r you,*r if*r he*r has*r a*r hundred*r sheep*r and*r has*r lost*r one*r of*r them,*r does*r not*r leave*r the*r ninety-nine*r in*r the*r open*r pasture*r and*r go*r after*r the*r one*r which*r is*r lost*r until*r he*r finds*r it?*r
When*r he*r has*r found*r it,*r he*r lays*r it*r on*r his*r shoulders,*r rejoicing.*r

And*r when*r he*r comes*r home,*r he*r calls*r together*r his*r friends*r and*r his*r neighbors,*r saying*r to*r them,*r ‘Rejoice*r with*r me,*r for*r I*r have*r found*r my*r sheep*r which*r was*r lost!’*r

I*r tell*r you*r that*r in*r the*r same*r way,*r there*r will*r be*r more*ir joy*r in*r heaven*r over*r one*r sinner*r who*r repents*r than*r over*r ninety-nine*r righteous*r persons*r who*r need*r no*r repentance.*r
The Lost Coin

“Or*rp what*r woman,*r if*r she*r has*r ten*r silver*r coins*r and*r loses*r one*r coin,*r does*r not*r light*r a*r lamp*r and*r sweep*r the*r house*r and*r search*r carefully*r until*r she*r finds*r it?*r
When*r she*r has*r found*r it,*r she*r calls*r together*r her*r friends*r and*r neighbors,*r saying,*r ‘Rejoice*r with*r me,*r for*r I*r have*r found*r the*r coin*r which*r I*r had*r lost!’*r
In*r the*r same*r way,*r I*r tell*r you,*r there*r is*r joy*r in*r the*r presence*r of*r the*r angels*r of*r God*r over*r one*r sinner*r who*r repents.”*r
The Prodigal Son
And*p He said, “A*r man*r had*r two*r sons.*r
The*r younger*r of*r them*r said*r to*r his*r father,*r ‘Father,*r give*r me*r the*r share*r of*r the*r estate*r that*r falls*r to*r me.’*r So*r he*r divided*r his*r wealth*r between*r them.*r

And*r not*r many*r days*r later,*r the*r younger*r son*r gathered*r everything*r together*r and*r went*r on*r a*r journey*r into*r a*r distant*r country,*r and*r there*r he*r squandered*r his*r estate*r with*r loose*r living.*r
Now*r when*r he*r had*r spent*r everything,*r a*r severe*r famine*r occurred*r in*r that*r country,*r and*r he*r began*r to*r be*r impoverished.*r
So*r he*r went*r and*r hired*r himself*r out*r to*r one*r of*r the*r citizens*r of*r that*r country,*r and*r he*r sent*r him*r into*r his*r fields*r to*r feed*r swine.*r
And*r he*r would*r have*r gladly*r filled*r his*r stomach*r with*r the*r pods*r that*r the*r swine*r were*r eating,*r and*r no*r one*r was*r giving*r anything*ir to*r him.*r
But*r when*r he*r came*r to*r his*r senses,*r he*r said,*r ‘How*r many*r of*r my*r father’s*r hired*r men*r have*r more*r than*r enough*r bread,*r but*r I*r am*r dying*r here*r with*r hunger!*r
I*r will*r get*r up*r and*r go*r to*r my*r father,*r and*r will*r say*r to*r him,*r “Father,*r I*r have*r sinned*r against*r heaven,*r and*r in*r your*r sight;*r
I*r am*r no*r longer*r worthy*r to*r be*r called*r your*r son;*r make*r me*r as*r one*r of*r your*r hired*r men.” ’*r

So*r he*r got*r up*r and*r came*r to*r his*r father.*r But*r while*r he*r was*r still*r a*r long*r way*r off,*r his*r father*r saw*r him*r and*r felt*r compassion*r for*ir him,*ir and*r ran*r and*r embraced*r him*r and*r kissed*r him.*r
And*r the*r son*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Father,*r I*r have*r sinned*r against*r heaven*r and*r in*r your*r sight;*r I*r am*r no*r longer*r worthy*r to*r be*r called*r your*r son.’*r
But*r the*r father*r said*r to*r his*r slaves,*r ‘Quickly*r bring*r out*r the*r best*r robe*r and*r put*r it*r on*r him,*r and*r put*r a*r ring*r on*r his*r hand*r and*r sandals*r on*r his*r feet;*r
and*r bring*r the*r fattened*r calf,*r kill*r it,*r and*r let*r us*r eat*r and*r celebrate;*r
for*r this*r son*r of*r mine*r was*r dead*r and*r has*r come*r to*r life*r again;*r he*r was*r lost*r and*r has*r been*r found.’*r And*r they*r began*r to*r celebrate.*r
“Now*rp his*r older*r son*r was*r in*r the*r field,*r and*r when*r he*r came*r and*r approached*r the*r house,*r he*r heard*r music*r and*r dancing.*r
And*r he*r summoned*r one*r of*r the*r servants*r and*r began*ir inquiring*r what*r these*r things*r could*r be.*r
And*r he*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Your*r brother*r has*r come,*r and*r your*r father*r has*r killed*r the*r fattened*r calf*r because*r he*r has*r received*r him*r back*r safe*r and*r sound.’*r
But*r he*r became*r angry*r and*r was*r not*r willing*r to*r go*r in;*r and*r his*r father*r came*r out*r and*r began*ir pleading*r with*r him.*r

But*r he*r answered*r and*r said*r to*r his*r father,*r ‘Look!*r For*r so*r many*r years*r I*r have*r been*r serving*r you*r and*r I*r have*r never*r neglected*r a*r command*r of*r yours;*r and*r yet*ir you*r have*r never*r given*r me*r a*r young*r goat,*r so*r that*r I*r might*r celebrate*r with*r my*r friends;*r
but*r when*r this*r son*r of*r yours*r came,*r who*r has*r devoured*r your*r wealth*r with*r prostitutes,*r you*r killed*r the*r fattened*r calf*r for*r him.’*r
And*r he*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Son,*r you*r have*r always*r been*r with*r me,*r and*r all*r that*r is*r mine*r is*r yours.*r
But*r we*r had*r to*r celebrate*r and*r rejoice,*r for*r this*r brother*r of*r yours*r was*r dead*r and*r has*ir begun*ir to*r live,*r and*r was*ir lost*r and*r has*r been*r found.’ ”*r
